intro: Cheiridopsis tuberculata, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant features a compact growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the winter months, making it a striking addition to rock gardens. Cheiridopsis tuberculata is well adapted to full sun and requires well-drained soil to thrive.
